example.para: This example creates an HTTP namespace.
Example: Create private DNS namespace
This example creates a public namespace based on DNS.
Example: Create service
Namespace sharee creates a service using a namespace ARN instead of namespace ID, useful when working with shared namespaces.
Example: Delete namespace
Deletes a namespace using a namespace ARN instead of namespace ID, useful when working with shared namespaces.
Example: Delete service
Deletes a service using a service ARN instead of service ID, useful when working with shared namespaces.
Example: Delete service attribute by providing attribute key and service ID
Deletes service attributes using a service ARN instead of service ID, useful for cross-account scenarios or when working with shared namespaces.

code.title: Delete service attributes using service ARN

example.para: Example: Deregister a service instance
Deregisters an instance using a service ARN instead of service ID, useful when working with shared namespaces.
Example: Discover registered instances
Discovers instances in a shared namespace by specifying the OwnerAccount parameter, useful when working with shared namespaces.
The following example discovers the revision ID for a registered instance.

code.title: To discover the revision for a registered instance

example.para: Discovers the instances revision in a shared namespace by specifying the OwnerAccount parameter, useful when working with shared namespaces.

code.title: Discover instances revision using owner account

example.para: This example gets information about a specified instance.
This example gets information about an instance using a service ARN instead of service ID. This is useful for listing instances associated with shared namespaces.

code.title: Get instance details using service ARN for shared namespace

example.para: This example gets the current health status of one or more instances that are associate with a specified service.
This example gets the current health status of instances using a service ARN instead of service ID. This is useful for checking health status of instances associated with shared namespaces.

code.title: Get instances health status using service ARN for shared namespace

example.para: This example gets information about a specified namespace.

Gets namespace information using a namespace ARN instead of namespace ID, useful when working with shared namespaces. Shows a namespace owned by another account (123456789012) that is shared with the current account.
Example: Get operation result
Gets operation information by specifying the OwnerAccount parameter for operations associated with shared namespaces.
This example gets the settings for a specified service.

Gets service settings using a service ARN instead of service ID, useful when working with shared namespaces. Shows a service created by a sharee (111122223333) in a namespace owned by another account (123456789012).
This example gets the attributes for a specified service.

Gets service attributes using a service ARN instead of service ID, useful when working with shared namespaces. Shows attributes for a service created by a sharee in a namespace owned by another account.

code.title: Get service attributes using service ARN

example.para: Example: List service instances
This example lists instances using a service ARN instead of service ID. This is useful for listing instances associated with shared namespaces.

code.title: List instances using service ARN for shared namespace

example.para: Example: List namespaces
This example shows how to list namespaces that are shared with you from other AWS accounts using the RESOURCE_OWNER filter.

code.title: List namespaces filtered by resource owner

example.para: This example gets the operations that have a STATUS of either PENDING or SUCCESS.
Example: List services

Lists services created in namespaces owned by other accounts using the RESOURCE_OWNER filter with OTHER_ACCOUNTS value, useful when working with shared namespaces. Account 111122223333 is making the request.

code.title: List services in shared namespaces using resource owner filter

example.para: This example lists the tags of a resource.
Example: Register Instance

Registers an instance using a service ARN instead of service ID, useful when working with shared namespaces. Shows registering an instance to a service created by a sharee in a namespace owned by another account.
This example adds "Department" and "Project" tags to a resource.
This example removes the "Department" and "Project" tags from a resource.
The following example updates the description of a HTTP namespace.
This example updates an HTTP namespace using a namespace ARN instead of namespace ID.

code.title: Update HTTP namespace using namespace ARN for shared namespace

example.para: This example submits a request to change the health status of an instance associated with a service with a custom health check to HEALTHY.
Updates instance custom health status using a service ARN instead of service ID, useful when working with shared namespaces.

code.title: Update instance custom health status using service ARN

example.para: The following example updates the description of a private DNS namespace.

code.title: To update a private DNS namespace

example.para: This example updates a private DNS namespace using a namespace ARN instead of namespace ID.

code.title: Update private DNS namespace using namespace ARN for shared namespace

example.para: The following example updates the description of a public DNS namespace.

code.title: To update a public DNS namespace

example.para: This example updates a public DNS namespace using a namespace ARN instead of namespace ID.

code.title: Update public DNS namespace using namespace ARN for shared namespace

example.para: This example submits a request to replace the DnsConfig and HealthCheckConfig settings of a specified service.
This example updates a service using a service ARN instead of service ID. This is useful for updating services associated with shared namespaces.

code.title: Update service using service ARN for shared namespace

example.para: This example submits a request to update the specified service to add a port attribute with the value 80.
Updates service attributes using a service ARN instead of service ID, useful when working with shared namespaces.

code.title: Update service attributes using service ARN
